hkg_dim_segment.table_description: Table named "hkg_dim_segment" stores information about segments. It has the following columns: name, definition, totalProfiles. The column totalProfiles contains the number of profiles/users/customers in a segment.  This table can be used when asked about Audiences, how many profiles.
hkg_dim_segment.column_description: The merge policy that is used to merge the profiles in this segment.

The column totalProfiles contains the number of profiles/users/customers in a segment.  This table can be used when asked about Audiences, how many profiles.
hkg_dim_segment.column_description: Whether the segment is a streaming segment. Streaming is applied against incoming data to Real-Time Customer Profile i.e. we get ongoing data.

hkg_dim_segment.table_description: Table named "hkg_dim_segment" stores information about segments. It has the following columns: name, definition, totalProfiles. The column totalProfiles contains the number of profiles/users/customers in a segment.  This table can be used when asked about Audiences, how many profiles.
hkg_dim_segment.column_description: Whether the segment is a batch segment. Batch is moving all profile data at once.

hkg_dim_segment.table_description: Table named "hkg_dim_segment" stores information about segments. It has the following columns: name, definition, totalProfiles. The column totalProfiles contains the number of profiles/users/customers in a segment.  This table can be used when asked about Audiences, how many profiles.
hkg_dim_segment.column_description: Whether the segment is an edge segment. Edge is the ability to evaluate segments in Platform instantaneously

hkg_dim_segment.column_description: The time-to-live in days for the segment.

hkg_dim_dataset.table_description: Table named "hkg_dim_dataset" stores information about datasets. Datasets are ingested via source connectors and have some attributes. hkg_dim_schema.table_description: Table named "hkg_dim_schema" stores information about schema. This schema corresponds to one or multiple datasets. It has the following columns: schemaId (primary key), schemaType, name, description, requiredFields, extends, immutableTags.  This table can be used when asked about schema, class and associated with any Entity Relationship Tables.

hkg_dim_schema.column_description: The tenant container of the schema. Tenant is the: container is used for schemas owned by the organization. we use tenant when working with your own data

hkg_br_dataset_segment.table_description: Table named hkg_br_dataset_segment contains list of datasets which are used in segments or audiences.  Each segment or audience will have one or more datasets associated with it. One dataset can be used across one or more segments or audiences
